So relationship direction: descendant -> (someone above). So we can view the graph as edges from descendant to ancestor (i.e., upward) or from ancestor to descendant (downward). Let's formalize. For each statement: "A is B's descendant" means B is an ancestor of A. So there is a relationship that A is "child"/descendant of B. "X is Y's ancestor" means X is ancestor of Y, i.e., Y is descendant of X. So statements are given both ways.
